intro: Macromiscus glandulosus, commonly known as the glandular macromiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers that often display vibrant colors. Native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its growth habit is typically herbaceous, with slender stems and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
